items.title: Pepi en voormalig Eredivisie-trio op lijst met Duitse transferflops
items.summary: Ryan Babel, Ricardo Pepi, Alexander Isak en Arkadiusz Milik staan er wat minder goed op in Duitsland dan in Nederland. Voor het (voormalig) Eredivisie-kwartet is een plekje ingeruimd in een lijst waarin wordt teruggeblikt op de grootste mislukte Duitse wintertransfers ooit.

items.title: VI Live: Paix√£o jaagt tegen PSG op eerste prijs in Frankrijk
items.summary: Voetballiefhebbers kunnen hun vingers donderdag weer aflikken. Zo speelt het Liverpool van Arne Slot in de Premier League tegen koploper Arsenal, staan Atl√©tico en Real Madrid tegenover elkaar in de halve finale van de Spaanse Supercopa en strijden Paris Saint-Germain en Olympique Marseille om de Franse Supercup. Volg alles in de VI Live.

items.title: Heracles slaat nieuwe slag: club huurt middenvelder van St. Pauli
items.summary: Heracles heeft zich verzekert van de komst van Erik Ahlstrand. De 24-jarige Zweed komt op huurbasis over van Bundesliga-club FC St. Pauli en is na Lequincio Zeefuik de tweede winterse versterking van de Almelo√´rs. Heracles heeft de mogelijk om de middenvelder na dit seizoen definitief over te nemen.

items.title: Topaankoop en ex-Ajacied Kudus maanden uit de roulatie bij Spurs
items.summary: Tottenham Hotspur kan voorlopig geen beroep doen op Mohammed Kudus. De Ghanese aanvaller liep zondag een dijbeenblessure op tegen Sunderland en is maanden uitgeschakeld, bevestigde manager Thomas Frank. De Deen verwacht de voormalig Ajacied pas weer in april terug.

items.title: Spelfout in PSV-banner blijkt reclamestunt
items.summary: Een spandoek in Eindhoven heeft voor de nodige opschudding gezorgd. PSV gaf bij het Philips Stadion een mooie boodschap aan de fans, maar een spelfout werd gezien als hint voor een contractverlenging.

items.title: 'Young leader' Romero defended by under-fire Frank
items.summary: Tottenham head coach Thomas Frank defends captain Cristian Romero after he appeared to take aim at the club's hierarchy.

items.title: Mourinho on shock loss: I hope players don't sleep
items.summary: An angry Benfica coach Jose Mourinho hopes his players had a sleepless night after their shock defeat to Braga in the Portuguese Allianz Cup semifinal on Wednesday.

items.title: Trinity Rodman headlines USWNT Jan. camp roster
items.summary: Forward Trinity Rodman, who is out of contract with a club, will join the United States women's national team in training camp later this month for the first time since April 2025.

items.title: Spurs captain Romero in fiery 'lies' post after loss
items.summary: Tottenham captain Cristian Romero appeared to accuse the club's hierarchy of "lies" in a fiery, now-edited social media post following the defeat to Bournemouth.

items.title: Rosenior unready to coach Chelsea loss at Fulham
items.summary: Liam Rosenior chose not to take charge of Chelsea for the first time in Wednesday's Premier League clash against Fulham because of the "difficult time-frame" between his appointment on Tuesday and the game at Craven Cottage.

items.title: Dolphins fire head coach McDaniel
items.summary: Mike McDaniel has become the NFL's latest postseason coaching casualty after he was relieved of his duties by the Miami Dolphins.

items.title: The PL players free to negotiate a transfer with foreign clubs in January
items.summary: A number of Premier League stars have entered the final six months of their deals and can now negotiate pre-contract agreements with foreign clubs.

items.title: 'A gift I can't repay' - McDonald on playing with brother's kidney
items.summary: Five years after receiving a kidney from his brother, Exeter midfielder Kevin McDonald is preparing to face Manchester City in the FA Cup.

items.title: US actions in Venezuela put the 2026 World Cup in disgraceful company | Leander Schaerlaeckens
items.summary: In 1934 and 1978, Fifa‚Äôs big event was given over to authoritarian aims. There‚Äôs no more doubt that 2026 will be the same By 1934, it was entirely evident what Benito Mussolini was up to. Italy‚Äôs dictator had already consolidated power, colonized Libya and annexed the city of Rijeka. He nevertheless got to stage the second-ever World Cup, managing it with a heavy hand and even supplanting the Jules Rimet trophy with a far larger one. Hosting and winning that World Cup didn‚Äôt sate his expansionist appetites. By the end of decade, Mussolini would take Ethiopia, annex Albania and back Francisco Franco in the Spanish civil war. It was equally well established in 1978 in Argentina that General Jorge Rafa√©l Videla‚Äôs military junta, which had taken over two years earlier, was maintaining its grip on power through systematic detention, torture and murder. Still, protestations from other nations were ignored and the World Cup kicked off. Leander Schaerlaeckens‚Äô book on the United States men‚Äôs national soccer team, The Long Game, is out on May 12. You can preorder it here. He teaches at Marist University. Continue reading...

items.title: Manchester United pulled off a coup by signing Lea Sch√ºller ‚Äì so what will she bring?
items.summary: ‚ÄòShe has everything to be a world-class striker ‚Äì fast, two great feet, good with the head and strong,‚Äô says the coach who set the forward‚Äôs career rolling Since they were promoted to the Women‚Äôs Super League in 2019, no Manchester United player has managed to score more than 10 league goals in a single season. In Lea Sch√ºller they have signed someone who has surpassed that mark seven seasons in a row in Germany‚Äôs Frauen Bundesliga, so it is easy to understand why United are so enamoured with their new striker. With a formidable 54 goals in 82 internationals, the Germany forward arrives at Carrington with a prolific record and the match-winner profile the club have been craving. At 28 years old she could spend the best years of her career at United, where she has signed a contract until June 2029. Continue reading...

items.title: What is Man Utd's 'DNA' and does it really matter?
items.summary: As Manchester United look for Ruben Amorim's successor, Phil McNulty asks if a club's so-called "DNA" is actually relevant?

items.title: Mourinho makes Benfica players sleep at training ground
items.summary: Jose Mourinho takes his players to stay at Benfica's training ground after they lose against Braga in the League Cup semi-final.

items.title: Ex-Premier League ref David Coote gets suspended sentence over schoolboy video
items.summary: Coote, 43, had previously pleaded guilty to making an indecent moving image of a child The former Premier League referee David Coote has been given a suspended sentence after he was found to have a sexual video of a 15-year-old boy in school uniform on his laptop. Judge Shant said Coote, 43, had a ‚Äúspectacular fall from grace‚Äù after police charged him with making a category A video, the most serious kind, of a 15-year-old schoolboy. The charge refers to activities such as downloading, sharing or saving photos or videos containing abuse. Continue reading...

items.title: Coote gets suspended prison sentence over child image offence
items.summary: David Coote has been sentenced to nine months in prison, suspended for two years, after pleading guilty to making an indecent image of a child.

items.title: Chiefs aware of domestic violence allegations directed towards Rice
items.summary: The Kansas City Chiefs said in a statement on Wednesday they were aware of domestic violence allegations made in a series of social media posts by a former girlfriend of wide receiver Rashee Rice and had been in communication with the NFL.
